text: (dramatic music)

- We live in an era where
people are as curious as ever.

And I think one of the most
humbling aspects of science

is that there are so many
things that are beyond
our realm of exploration or thought.
My name is Richard Wiese.

I'm President Emeritus
of the Explorers Club

and host of the television
series "Born to Explore."

I've been able to make a living
through seeing the world.

The Explorers Club was
founded in 1904 by a group

who were trying to be the
first to the North Pole,
first to the South, first on Everest,
and also the first on the moon.

I've been lucky enough to
see many world-class events.
I think this solar eclipse is something
that goes beyond world-class.
It goes to solar class.
Everything is turned on its head.

Birds stop chirping,
the temperature drops.
And every time there's a solar eclipse,

it allows us to see a part of
the universe we haven't seen.
This is gonna be one of those events

that people are gonna talk
about for a long time.
